intro: Crotalaria polygaloides subsp. polygaloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with slender stems and alternate leaves. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, a common feature among members of the Fabaceae family, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats.
